comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Thomas Henry Barry (October 13, 1855 – December 30, 1919) was a former United States Army Major General and Superintendent of the United States Military Academy from 1910–1912. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_Henry_Barry Mrs. L.M. Garrison would be the wife of: Lindley Miller Garrison (November 28, 1864 – October 19, 1932) was a New Jersey lawyer who served as Secretary of War under U.S. President Woodrow Wilson between 1913 and 1916. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lindley_Miller_Garrison

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: Thanks for the additional info.  We'll plan to add it to the description next time we update!

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Mrs. C. F. Roe would be the wife of Major General Charles Francis Roe. His NYT obituary was published on December 2, 1922: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0F14FC345A1B7A9... A picture is at New-York tribune. (New York [N.Y.]) 1866-1924, May 26, 1907, Image 48 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030214/1907-05-26/ed-... in panel of 5 portraits. She is second from right. According to www.usgennet.org/usa/topic/historical/southernnewyork/s_n... she was the former Miss Katherine Bissell. An obituary for her is at www.pa-roots.org/data/read.php?1112,626072

comment.author: 37270547@N08
comment._content: Just a small clarification:  Mrs. Roe's maiden name was Bogert...she was Katherine Bissell Bogert Roe.
